definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
to provoke/to irritate/to upset/to stimulate/to excite/irritant
to assassinate/(military) to fight with a bayonet/(baseball) to put out (a baserunner)
to be attacked by an assassin
stab of pain/sting/fig. stimulus to action/a prick

sentences.english: I got a splinter in my finger while I was moving the boxes.
sentences.chinese: 我在搬箱子的時候手指頭上紮了一根刺。

sentences.english: It took him quite some time to pick off the burs that had stuck to his coat.
sentences.chinese: 花了好長時間他才把粘在衣服上的刺摘掉。

sentences.english: The pangolin whole body's lamella is its thorn, is similar with the nail.
sentences.chinese: 穿山甲渾身的鱗片就是它的刺，與指甲相類似。

sentences.english: It remains a historic mystery whether Emperor Yongzheng was murdered.
sentences.chinese: 是否被刺身亡至今仍是一個歷史的謎案。

sentences.english: There was only one scorpion. But the sting was in the tail.
sentences.chinese: 只剩一隻蠍子了，但是刺卻在尾巴上。

sentences.english: Each time he returned and stabbed her again.
sentences.chinese: 但每次他都又返回來刺她。

sentences.english: The child was frightened by the hedgehog. The father rolled it out of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 孩子被這隻刺猥嚇壞了，父親把它從花園裏弄了出去。

sentences.english: The allergopharma allergic abstraction was used to detect the allergens with the skin prick test.
sentences.chinese: 採用阿羅格點刺試驗對患者進行變應原檢查。

sentences.english: Optimists see the flower, while pessimists see the thorns.
sentences.chinese: 樂觀者看見花，而悲觀者看到的刺。

sentences.english: Bob: Of course yes, it is tattoo some pictures on the skin.
sentences.chinese: 當然知道，就是在身體上刺上一些圖案。

sentences.english: A strong light impinged on his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一道強烈的光刺着他的眼睛。

sentences.english: He can deliver an instant kill thanks to his backstab ability.
sentences.chinese: 他的背刺能力能起到一擊必殺的效果。

sentences.english: Roses shave thorns, and silver fountains mud;
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花有刺，銀色的泉有爛泥。

sentences.english: The boat knifed through the waves.
KATHERINA. If I be waspish, best beware my sting.
sentences.chinese: 我倘然是黃蜂，那麼留心我的刺吧。

definition: to hit with a piercing blow
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
a thorn/fig. to ridicule sb/fig. sth wrong
to hack/to chop/to split open/(of lightning) to strike
